required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Myofunctional Therapy in Class II Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Myofunctional Therapy in Class II Patients With Functional Orthopedic Appliances. ECA

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized clinical trial , with a sample of 60 children with atypical swallowing, class II and with SN1 orthopedic appliances these patients were randomly divided into, group 1: 30 patients with SN1 orthopedic appliances and myofunctional therapy and group 2: 30 patients with SN1 orthopedic appliances and without myofunctional therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized clinical trial with two parallel arms, on a sample of 60 children with atypical swallowing, class II and with SN1 orthopedic appliances, these patients were randomly divided into, group 1: 30 patients with SN1 orthopedic appliances and myofunctional therapy and group 2: 30 patients with SN1 orthopedic appliances and without myofunctional therapy for the study. Both groups carried out the evaluation of the protocol that included: 1) evaluation of the dental occlusion class and skeletal classification 2) swallowing function test using the Payne technique; 3) Mioscaner analysis to measure perioral forces, i.e. tongue extension force, lip pressure, masseter contraction force.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized clinical trial with two parallel arms
study_design_info.masking_description: The operator responsible for making measurements of tongue position, mandibular advancement, orofacial muscle contraction, chin muscle activity, will be blinded to the assignment. A previous training will be carried out with an instruction manual for the clinical evaluation process

primary_outcome.measure: 41 / 5000 Resultados de traducción Efficacy of therapy / mandibular advancement
primary_outcome.description: It induces changes in the position of the mandibular bone towards a more advanced position
Physiological process in which the muscles develop tension and are shortened or stretched by a stimulus

primary_outcome.measure: Contraction of the masseter muscles and muscle activity of the chin
primary_outcome.description: 101 / 5000 Resultados de traducción Physiological process in which the muscles develop tension and are shortened or stretched by a stimulus

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 1, with myofunctional therapy and SN1 functional orthopedic appliances
arm_group.description: The participant will receive a session of myofunctional therapy every month, for 9 months. In this group, a series of procedures and techniques are carried out to create and mechanize muscular and orofacial patterns at rest and in function, eliminate habits, correct muscular imbalance, improve the aesthetics of the patient and normalize the functions of the stomatognathic system.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 2, without myofunctional therapy and SN1 functional orthopedic appliances.
arm_group.description: Once the investigation is finished, the patient will decide whether or not to perform myofunctional therapy one every month, for 9 months.

intervention.description: Group 1, with myofunctional therapy and SN1 functional orthopedic appliances The participant underwent a myofunctional therapy session every month, for 9 months. In this group, a series of procedures and techniques are carried out to create and mechanize muscular and orofacial patterns at rest and in function, eliminate habits, correct muscular imbalance, improve the aesthetics of the patient and normalize the functions of the stomatognathic system. The myofunctional therapy performed will be by an expert speech therapist
intervention.arm_group_label: Group 1, with myofunctional therapy and SN1 functional orthopedic appliances
Group 2, without myofunctional therapy and SN1 functional orthopedic appliances.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- the inclusion criteria the participants will be between
- 8 and 10 years old
- mixed dentition
- canine class II diagnosis and 2 to 4 mm
- molar according to Angle and overjet between 4 to 6 mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with systemic involvement
- congenital malformations
- facial deformities
- Open bite
- oral breathing
- finger sucking habit will be excluded
